org.openimaj.video.processing.shotdetector

Class CombiShotDetector

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.openimaj.video.Video<T>
      • org.openimaj.video.processor.VideoProcessor<I>
        • org.openimaj.video.processing.shotdetector.VideoShotDetector<MBFImage>
          • org.openimaj.video.processing.shotdetector.CombiShotDetector
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, AutoCloseable, Iterable<MBFImage>, VideoDisplayListener<MBFImage>

    public class CombiShotDetector
extends VideoShotDetector<MBFImage>
    A shot detector that uses evidence from a number of shot detectors to determine if a shot has been detected.

    It runs the shot detection for each detector that is registered with the class and if it determines that a shot boundary occurred the score is increased by the weighting value for that detector. The final score is divided by the number of detectors to get a probability value for the frame being a shot boundary. By default the threshold is set to 0.75 - that is, there must be a 3/4 correlation of shot boundary for it to be considered a shot boundary.

    Version:
    $Author$, $Revision$, $Date$
    Author:
    David Dupplaw (dpd@ecs.soton.ac.uk)
